page.title: 13OUTING TO EDINBURGH
page.content: {BY HELEN WRIGHT AGED 7 YEARS ON FRIDAY I CAME TO SCHOOL WITH MY MUM AND THE BUS HAD ARRIVED WHEN WE CAME. EVERYBODY GOT ON THE BUS AND WE HAD TO GO. WE WERE HALF WAY TO RIDING MILL WHEN SCOTT'S DAD CAME UP TO THE FRONT AND SAID HE HAD LEFT THE PUSHCHAIR BEHIND AND THAT THE BUS WOULD HAVE TO TURN BACK. WE STOPPED AT THE PUB AND SCOTT'S DAD RAN DOWN TO SCHOOL AND GOT THE PUSHCHAIR. THEN WE WERE OFF AGAIN. AT LAST WE GOT TO THE ZOO, AND WE SAW THE ELEPHANT, IT WAS SAD. THEN WE SAW THE ORANG UTANS, THEY WERE FUNNY, THEN WE MADE OUR WAY TO THE OTTERS, THEY WERE YELLOW. THEN WE MADE OUR WAY TO THE SMALL ANIMIAL HANDLING CLASS. WE HANDLED RATS AND TOADS AND OTHER THINGS, AND THEN I WENT TO THE ZOO SHOP AND GOT SOME THINGS . THEN I WENT TO THE MONKEY HOUSE.
